data.chText: （使…）砰地关上
data.enText: to shut, or to make sth shut, with a lot of force, making a loud noise

data.chText: 我听见他随手砰地把门关上了。
data.enText: I heard the door slam behind him.

data.chText: 风吹得一扇窗户咣地关上了。
data.enText: A window slammed shut in the wind.

data.chText: 他怒气冲冲地从房子里出来，随手把门砰地关上。
data.enText: He stormed out of the house, slamming the door as he left.

data.chText: 她砰的一声盖上盖子。
data.enText: She slammed the lid shut.

data.chText: 用力一放；使劲一推；猛劲一摔
data.enText: to put, push or throw sth into a particular place or position with a lot of force

data.chText: 她气呼呼地啪的一声挂上电话。
data.enText: She slammed down the phone angrily.

data.chText: 他猛地刹住汽车。
data.enText: He slammed on the brakes (= stopped the car very suddenly) .

data.chText: 猛烈抨击
data.enText: to criticize sb/sth very strongly

data.id-g-sent: to shut/slam the door in sb's face

data.enText: slam into/against sb/sth
slam sth into/against sb/sth

data.chText: （使）重重地撞上
data.enText: to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth crash into sth with a lot of force

data.chText: 猛关（或推、摔、撞等）；猛摔（或撞等）的声音
data.enText: an act of slamming sth; the noise of sth being slammed

data.chText: 她使劲一推，门砰的一声关上了。
data.enText: She gave the door a good hard slam.

data.chText: 以上各词均含碰撞、撞击之义，尤指撞车。
data.enText: These are all words that can be used when sth, especially a vehicle, hits sth else very hard and is damaged or destroyed.
crash

data.chText: 指（使）物体或交通工具碰撞或撞击：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to hit an object or another vehicle, causing damage; to make a vehicle do this

data.chText: 飞机会失事把我吓坏了。
data.enText: I was terrified that the plane would crash.
slam (sth) into/against sb/sth

data.chText: 指（使）重重地撞上：
data.enText: to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this

data.chText: 汽车打滑，重重地撞到树上。
data.enText: The car skidded and slammed into a tree.
collide

data.chText: 指交通工具或人碰撞、相撞或撞上：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) (of two vehicles or people) to crash into each other; (of a vehicle or person) to crash into sb/sth else

data.chText: 那辆小轿车和货车在浓雾中迎面相撞。
data.enText: The car and the van collided head-on in thick fog.
smash

data.chText: 指（使）猛烈撞击、猛烈碰撞或撞车：
data.enText: ( rather informal ) to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth do this; to crash a car

data.chText: 飙车抢劫者驾着偷来的汽车撞破商店橱窗。
data.enText: Ramraiders smashed a stolen car through the shop window.

data.chText: 用crash、slam还是smash？
crash尤指交通工具碰撞，可不与介词连用：
data.enText: Crash is used particularly for vehicles and can be used without a preposition.

data.chText: 我们要坠毁了，是不是？
data.enText: We're going to crash, aren't we?

data.chText: slam和smash表示此义时总是与介词连用：
data.enText: In this meaning slam and smash always take a preposition.
We're going to slam/smash, aren't we?

data.chText: 两词均可用于除交通工具外的范围更广的事物。crash与介词连用也可用于其他事物：
data.enText: They are used for a much wider range of things than just vehicles. Crash can also be used for other things, if used with a preposition.

data.chText: 他砰的一声将电话听筒摔下来。
data.enText: He crashed down the telephone receiver.
crash, slam or smash?
wreck

data.chText: 指使交通工具撞坏或毁坏
data.enText: to crash a vehicle and damage it so badly that it is not worth repairing
The two vehicles crashed/collided.
The two vehicles crashed/slammed/smashed into each other .
The car/plane crashed/slammed/smashed into a tree.
I've crashed/smashed/wrecked the car .
to crash/slam/collide/smash head-on (into/with sth)
shut/slam the door in sb's face

data.chText: 将某人拒之门外；让某人吃闭门羹
data.enText: to shut a door hard when sb is trying to come in

data.chText: 拒绝见某人；拒绝同某人谈话
data.enText: to refuse to talk to sb or meet them, in a rude way
slam into/against sb/sth
slam sth into/against sb/sth

data.chText: （使）重重地撞上
data.enText: to crash into sth with a lot of force; to make sth crash into sth with a lot of force

tr: an aggressive remark directed at a person like a missile and intended to have a telling effect
example: she takes a dig at me every chance she gets

tr: a forceful impact that makes a loud noise
the noise made by the forceful impact of two objects
winning all or all but one of the tricks in bridge

example: He slammed the book on the table

value.def: If you slam a door or window or if it slams, it shuts noisily and with great force.

example.ex: She slammed the door and locked it behind her...
example.tran: 她砰的一下关上门，随手锁上了。

example.ex: I was relieved to hear the front door slam...
example.tran: 听见前门砰的一声关上了，我松了一口气。

example.ex: He slammed the gate shut behind him.
example.tran: 他顺手把身后的门猛地关上了。

value.def: If you slam something down, you put it there quickly and with great force.

example.ex: She listened in a mixture of shock and anger before slamming the phone down.
example.tran: 她又惊又气地听着电话，然后啪地挂断了。

value.def: To slam someone or something means to criticize them very severely.

example.ex: The famed film-maker slammed the claims as 'an outrageous lie'...
example.tran: 这位大名鼎鼎的电影制片人声色俱厉地抨击了这些说法，称之为“无耻的谎言”。

example.ex: Britain has been slammed by the United Nations for having one of the worst race relations records in the world.
example.tran: 由于在处理种族关系方面的表现位列全世界最糟糕的国家之一，英国遭到了联合国的严厉批评。

value.def: If one thing slams into or against another, it crashes into it with great force.

example.ex: The plane slammed into the building after losing an engine shortly after take-off...
example.tran: 飞机起飞之后不久，就有一个引擎出现故障，随即便一头撞上了大楼。

example.ex: He slammed me against the ground.
example.tran: 他把我狠狠地摔在了地上。
